    • Constructor Detail

      • Shimmer

        public Shimmer(Context context,
       Handler handler,
       java.lang.String myName,
       java.lang.Boolean continousSync)
        Constructor. Prepares a new BluetoothChat session.
        Parameters:
        context - The UI Activity Context
        handler - A Handler to send messages back to the UI Activity
        myname - To allow the user to set a unique identifier for each Shimmer device
        countiousSync - A boolean value defining whether received packets should be checked continuously for the correct start and end of packet.

      • Shimmer

        public Shimmer(Context context,
       Handler handler,
       java.lang.String myName,
       double samplingRate,
       int accelRange,
       int gsrRange,
       int setEnabledSensors,
       boolean continousSync)
        Constructor. Prepares a new BluetoothChat session. Additional fields allows the device to be set up immediately.
        Parameters:
        context - The UI Activity Context
        handler - A Handler to send messages back to the UI Activity
        myname - To allow the user to set a unique identifier for each Shimmer device
        samplingRate - Defines the sampling rate
        accelRange - Defines the Acceleration range. Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2 are 0 (+/- 1.5g), 1 (+/- 2g), 2 (+/- 4g) and 3 (+/- 6g). Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2r are 0 (+/- 1.5g) and 3 (+/- 6g).
        gsrRange - Numeric value defining the desired gsr range. Valid range settings are 0 (10kOhm to 56kOhm), 1 (56kOhm to 220kOhm), 2 (220kOhm to 680kOhm), 3 (680kOhm to 4.7MOhm) and 4 (Auto Range).
        setEnabledSensors - Defines the sensors to be enabled (e.g. 'Shimmer.SENSOR_ACCEL|Shimmer.SENSOR_GYRO' enables the Accelerometer and Gyroscope)
        countiousSync - A boolean value defining whether received packets should be checked continuously for the correct start and end of packet.

    • Method Detail

      • getShimmerState

        public int getShimmerState()
        Return the current connection state.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String address,
           java.lang.String bluetoothLibrary)
        Start the ConnectThread to initiate a connection to a remote device. The purpose of having two libraries is because some Stock firmware do not implement the full Bluetooth Stack. In such cases use 'gerdavax'. If problems persist consider installing an aftermarket firmware, with a mature Bluetooth stack.
        Parameters:
        address - Bluetooth Address of Device to connect too
        bluetoothLibrary - Supported libraries are 'default' and 'gerdavax'

      • connected

        public void connected(BluetoothSocket socket,
             BluetoothDevice device)
        Start the ConnectedThread to begin managing a Bluetooth connection
        Parameters:
        socket - The BluetoothSocket on which the connection was made
        device - The BluetoothDevice that has been connected

      • getInstructionStatus

        public boolean getInstructionStatus()
        This returns the variable mTransactionCompleted which indicates whether the Shimmer device is in the midst of a command transaction. True when no transaction is taking place. This is deprecated since the update to a thread model for executing commands
        Returns:
        mTransactionCompleted

        Parameters:
        newPacket - a byte array containing the current received packet
        Instructions - an array string containing the commands to execute. It is currently not fully supported

      • sensorConflictCheck

        public boolean sensorConflictCheck(int enabledSensors)

      • writeAccelRange

        public void writeAccelRange(int range)
        writeAccelRange(range) sets the Accelerometer range on the Shimmer to the value of the input range. When setting/changing the accel range, please ensure you have the correct calibration parameters. Note that the Shimmer device can only carry one set of accel calibration parameters at a single time.
        Parameters:
        range - is a numeric value defining the desired accelerometer range. Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2 are 0 (+/- 1.5g), 1 (+/- 2g), 2 (+/- 4g) and 3 (+/- 6g). Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2r are 0 (+/- 1.5g) and 3 (+/- 6g).

      • writeSamplingRate

        public void writeSamplingRate(double rate)
        Parameters:
        rate - Defines the sampling rate to be set (e.g.51.2 sets the sampling rate to 51.2Hz). User should refer to the document Sampling Rate Table to see all possible values.

      • writeEnabledSensors

        public void writeEnabledSensors(int enabledSensors)
        Transmits a command to the Shimmer device to enable the sensors. To enable multiple sensors an or operator should be used (e.g. writeEnabledSensors(Shimmer.SENSOR_ACCEL|Shimmer.SENSOR_GYRO|Shimmer.SENSOR_MAG)). Command should not be used consecutively. Valid values are SENSOR_ACCEL, SENSOR_GYRO, SENSOR_MAG, SENSOR_ECG, SENSOR_EMG, SENSOR_GSR, SENSOR_EXP_BOARD_A7, SENSOR_EXP_BOARD_A0, SENSOR_STRAIN and SENSOR_HEART. SENSOR_BATT
        Parameters:
        enabledSensors - e.g SENSOR_ACCEL|SENSOR_GYRO|SENSOR_MAG

      • readCalibrationParameters

        public void readCalibrationParameters(java.lang.String sensor)
        Parameters:
        sensor - is a string value that defines the sensor. Accepted sensor values are "Accelerometer","Gyroscope","Magnetometer","ECG","EMG","All"

      • writeBufferSize

        public void writeBufferSize(int size)
        writeAccelRange(range) sets the Accelerometer range on the Shimmer to the value of the input range. When setting/changing the accel range, please ensure you have the correct calibration parameters. Note that the Shimmer device can only carry one set of accel calibration parameters at a single time.
        Parameters:
        range - is a numeric value defining the desired accelerometer range. Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2 are 0 (+/- 1.5g), 1 (+/- 2g), 2 (+/- 4g) and 3 (+/- 6g). Valid range setting values for the Shimmer 2r are 0 (+/- 1.5g) and 3 (+/- 6g).

      • readFWVersion

        public void startStreaming()

      • writeGSRRange

        public void writeGSRRange(int range)
        writeGSRRange(range) sets the GSR range on the Shimmer to the value of the input range.
        Parameters:
        range - numeric value defining the desired GSR range. Valid range settings are 0 (10kOhm to 56kOhm), 1 (56kOhm to 220kOhm), 2 (220kOhm to 680kOhm), 3 (680kOhm to 4.7MOhm) and 4 (Auto Range).

      • readSamplingRate

        public void readSamplingRate()

      • inquiry

        public void inquiry()
        An inquiry is used to request for the current configuration parameters from the Shimmer device (e.g. Accelerometer settings, Configuration Byte, Sampling Rate, Number of Enabled Sensors and Sensors which have been enabled).

      • readShimmerVersion

        public void readShimmerVersion()

      • readConfigByte0

        public void readConfigByte0()

      • writeConfigByte0

        public void writeConfigByte0(byte configByte0)
        writeConfigByte0(configByte0) sets the config byte0 value on the Shimmer to the value of the input configByte0.
        Parameters:
        configByte0 - is an unsigned 8 bit value defining the desired config byte 0 value.

      • writeInstruction

        public void writeInstruction()

      • writePMux

        public void writePMux(int setBit)
        Sets the Pmux bit value on the Shimmer to the value of the input SETBIT. The PMux bit is the 2nd MSB of config byte0.
        Parameters:
        setBit - value defining the desired setting of the PMux (1=ON, 0=OFF).

      • writeFiveVoltReg

        public void writeFiveVoltReg(int setBit)
        Enable/disable the 5 Volt Regulator on the Shimmer ExpBoard board
        Parameters:
        setBit - value defining the desired setting of the Volt regulator (1=ENABLED, 0=DISABLED).

      • setBattLimitWarning

        public void setBattLimitWarning(double limit)
        Set the battery voltage limit, when the Shimmer device goes below the limit while streaming the LED on the Shimmer device will turn Yellow, in order to use battery voltage monitoring the Battery has to be enabled. See writeenabledsensors.
        Parameters:
        limit -

      • enable3DOrientation

        public void enable3DOrientation(boolean enable)

      • enableLowPowerMag

        public void enableLowPowerMag(boolean enable)
        This enables the low power mag option. When not enabled the sampling rate of the mag is set to the closest value to the actual sampling rate that it can achieve. In low power mode it defaults to 10Hz
        Parameters:
        enable -

      • isLowPowerMagEnabled

        public boolean isLowPowerMagEnabled()

      • enableOnTheFlyGyroCal

        public void enableOnTheFlyGyroCal(boolean enable,
                         int bufferSize,
                         double threshold)
        Parameters:
        enable - this enables the calibration of the gyroscope while streaming
        bufferSize - sets the buffersize of the window used to determine the new calibration parameters, see implementation for more details
        threshold - sets the threshold of when to use the incoming data to recalibrate gyroscope offset, this is in degrees, and the default value is 1.2

      • isGyroOnTheFlyCalEnabled

        public boolean isGyroOnTheFlyCalEnabled()
